column5: Does anyone know of a reliable shop to find 1/2oz titanium spinnerbaits? I live in Mississauga and dont mind a little driving. I found 3/8oz ones at Lebaron a couple years ago.  Every time I go to BPS they are sold out and LeBaron only carries 3/8oz ones.  Any help out there?  RJ  PS I hate the 1/2oz SS ones because I have had pike and bass strike them and put them out of true without being hooked.
If BPS stocks what you want, why not just order what you want on-line or by phone?
I bought a couple at Lebaron 2 weeks ago. They had both when I was there.
I was kind of hoping to get it for this weekend and International orders are generally 7-10 days. I will have to check LeBaron on the way home.  RJ

If you can't find the 1/2 oz ones, get the 3/8 and crimp a sinker onto the shank of the hook right behind the skirt. Often times, this works better than a 1/2 oz spinnerbait: runs true and gives a more compact profile.
Thanks Verminator, picked up two last night at Lebarons  RJ
The rubber core sinkers work pretty well for adding weight to a spinnerbait, just pull out the rubber core and crimp to the hook.

ebay always has good deals on fishing lures - you just have to watch the shipping prices. i just won 2 separate auctions (3 terminator spinnerbaits in each auction - first set of 3 were the titanium series, and the other set was the stainless series). got the whole lot for $18 + $7 shipping... $25 for 6 terminator spinnerbaits... can't beat that! works out to just over $4 a piece!
I have bought many lures off of E bay. Some good,some crap.
Amen to that.  Been doing it for years.  Especially good with keeping smaller profile baits down deep for smallies on shield lakes.  Shhhhhh, don't tell anybody...
